Patch Set 7:

This appears to be failing Jenkins because it needs the interfaces defined in this commit:
    https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/38385/12..22

The commit is currently marked "WIP".  I last reviewed it at PS12 and have not received any feedback to my comments.  Please work as a team to get this resolved.

Patch Set 7:

> Patch Set 7:
> 
> This appears to be failing Jenkins because it needs the interfaces defined in this commit:
>     https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/38385/12..22
> 
> The commit is currently marked "WIP".  I last reviewed it at PS12 and have not received any feedback to my comments.  Please work as a team to get this resolved.

Sure Patrick, we will work on this and update the patchset.

Hi All,

This patch is failed due to dependency patch in phosphor-dbus-interfaces (https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/38385).
For now, setting this review as WIP. Once dependency patch is merged, will set this review to active.

Thanks,
Jayashree

Patch Set 11:

(4 comments)

Patch Set 11:

(9 comments)

Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(12 comments)

Patch Set 11:

(23 comments)

Abandoned

close due to inactivity

What is this global map??  Why are the values all empty strings?

At a minimum this should be part of the object.

Instead of strings for keys, would it make more sense to use enumerations?  Using strings for lookup is kind of clumsy.
The values for this map will be getting from machine layer, so it has empty strings. Now I declared this in const variable in the latest patch.
Won't this further throw an exception if getPropertyValue threw an exception because it'll return an invalid variant.  I'd suggest cleaning up the error paths throughout this code.
yes, that exception will be caught under getPropertValue func in line 122.

Having one piece of code turn an exception into a bad variant only to have another piece of code later turn it into another exception only to have something else catch it and turn it into a meaningless log function is not particularly great error handling.
Should these be driven by config as well?
Here, power and system led will be changed as per the position property and same leds will be changed based on power and health status. So, these leds has been triggered physically instead of config.

I would suggest 'Sled' rather than 'SLED' if you want to use that term.  'SLED' is not an acronym and since this is in the LED controlling code it is quite possible to be confused with something related to LEDs.
Ack
This seems to be a lot of code to put into the header.  Can you move this into the .cpp part?
Ack, Moved this part to .cpp
Please use sdbusplus::bus::match::propertiesChanged() helper.
Sure, updated in the latest patchset.
Why aren't you looking at the position at all here?  This doesn't seem right to me.  Can you at least leave comments as to why you are discarding the data in the signal?
I have moved this part to .cpp file and also read the data from the signal.

I would suggest this is enabled by default and then disabled in the PACKAGECONFIG in the recipe.  By leaving as 'disabled' here we end up with a bunch of code that isn't compiled in CI and can potentially have un-realized problems until after it is merged.
Ack
Doesn't this add this class for everyone?  Is that ok?
yes, only if json file exists, this will proceed further. So I think, it won't affect others.
Please don't #define in C++ code and especially not something like "BMC".  What is this magic number used for?  Define a constant for it.  How do you know that there are only 4 hosts?
Ack, Removed Macro and enabled "OBMC_HOST_INSTANCES" to get the number of hosts.
I see no description anywhere of what this function is intended to do.  There is a fairly complex algorithm and I have no idea why this is the right algorithm.
Ack, Added description in the latest patchset.
Is there some kind of configuration we can use to know how many hosts there are suppose to be rather than relying on a static maximum?
Ack, Enabled "OBMC_HOST_INSTANCES" to get the number of hosts.
Suggest a return here for short circuiting and reducing the indentation.
Ack
Rather than using pointers, I would suggest std::holds_variant<string>(power) and then us the normal std::get<string> in the good path.
Ack

Why 45?

Is this expected to be an sdbusplus enumeration?  If so, use the appropriate sdbusplus::message::from_string<enum>(...) function.
Ack

It seems as if you never use this position as anything except a string.  Can we simply do the string conversion early then and pass it along as a (const string&)?  It would save a lot of duplicate `to_string` calls.
Sure, Updated in the latest patchset.
Still want to see a better error handling situation here.
Ack

Rather than return a variant and make the caller deal with converting from a variant to an underlying type, can we make this a template function and handle the conversion in a consistent way here?  Maybe we should even refactor an enhance whatever is in this 'dbusHandler.getProperty' to similarly make it a template?
Ack, Modified code using template function to get the variant type.
Are there any cases where we are wanting an empty variant and not just turning it into another exception?  (Again, I think the error path here should be re-examined throughout).
No cases for empty variant, Updated this in latest patchset.

This is another case where a template seems appropriate (in the underlying setProperty method).  The caller shouldn't have to form a bogus variant.  This ends up being a dbus detail that is bubbling up pretty high into application layers; it happens that the dbus SetProperty method takes a variant, but applications would know what type the property really is and shouldn't be forced to know that the dbus transaction requires it to be sent across the bus as a variant type).
Ack
Don't form these strings yourself.  Use the sdbusplus enum type throughout the code.
Ack, Added enum for led Action.
Why uint16 and not a size_t?
Ack

If you use sdbusplus enumerations, this whole thing turns into a case statement.  Makes it much more obvious to know you've covered the full space (actually, it becomes a compile failure if you don't).
Ack, Changed this into switch case statement.
Suggest saving this once in the function if you want to continue to pass as an integer here.
Ack

This is kind of silly to construct a string and then turn around and call `c_str` on it.

    static const auto configFilePath = "...";
Ack
This seems like a typical case on most machines and now we're making an Error-level journal statement.
Ack
This is a bug.  You should not be constructing a *new* bus and then destructing it when you leave this function.  Figure out a way to get the application level bus.
Ack
How do you know all PropertyChanged signals are this particular variant type?  Please use the Buttons::Selector::PropertiesVariant.
Ack
Suggest a decltype here to ensure simple refactoring if the underlying type changes (why isn't it size_t at a dbus level?).
auto.  DRY.
Ack
Ack
I have no idea what this means and why it is here.  Please add some more documentation.  Preferably a more self-documenting function name.
Ack, Added a description in the sled() function.
Can we do something with include paths in meson to avoid a "../"?
Ack
size_t?
Ack, Updated in the latest patchset.
Can you put units on this description?
Done

It isn't obvious why you chose uint8_t and uint16_t here.  I think you did it because the type in the dbus-interfaces are these?  I would suggest either using some kind of using/decltype to base the type on the underlying PDI property type, or defer the type conversion until the point where you are making the function calls to the PDI class.
Yes, based on dbus-interface property type, I have used this datatype. In updated patchset, I have used "using" to declare the type.
size_t?
Ack, Updated in the latest patchset.
I don't see this used now.
Ack
There's still quite a bit to do here.
Thanks for your suggestions, I will work on the following review comments.

We should probably just move utils.cpp into the primary list (line 4) and remove it from here and line 15.  LTO will remove any unused symbols in the executable so there really isn't much harm in including it all the time.
Ack
Just use ...Chassis::PowerState here.  sdbusplus / PDI already know how to parse the string into the C++ enum for you.  That eliminates all the if conditions below.
Ack
Can be replaced with constexpr string instead of hardcoded value ?
Ack
What about the TransitioningToOff/On states?
Ack
`getSubTreePaths` will log an error when the response is empty, perhaps `getSubTreePathsRaw` should be used here instead?
Ack
Please give meaningful variable name here?
Ack
This else if block is not necessary, if you add the code in the above if (action == Action::Blink) ?

None of this is necessary.  Use PDI enums to begin with and they can automatically be converted in the setProperty call.  'Action' should be of type `xyz::openbmc_project::Led::server::Physical::Action`.
Ack
Why are we ever setting Physical LEDs?  We should trigger a group and the group should trigger the physical LEDs.  Never trigger physical LEDs directly in code.
Ack
these multiple setPhysicalLed calls can be simplified using lambda methods
Ack
This needs to be reworked to leverage LED groups.
Ack
here also multiple method calls can be reduced to two calls by providing a method named getLedAction() as 2nd parameter for setPhysicalLed() method
Ack
can event handling like sd_event introduced here.is it possible?
Agreed.  An infinite loop isn't appropriate.  Spawn off sd_event timers as appropriate and/or react to dbus signals.
Ack
Can use range based loop here ?
Ack
This should also be handled as a Group (sled identify).  If it has higher priority behavior on the Power/System LEDs, that should be represented in the JSON.
Ack
Can use range based loop here ?
Ack
Variable declaration should not be in middle of the function ? It should be in starting of the function.
Ack
getSubTreePathsRaw ?
Ack
can sdbusplus match added to handle these property changes?
Ack
Declare meaningful name for pos, prop variables.
Ack
Why are we defining these ourselves?  Use what is in phosphor-dbus-interfaces headers.
Ack
Prefer you to use xyz::openbmc_project::Led::client::Group::interface and similar for all the interfaces.  Tie to what is in the PDI headers.
Ack
This is an undocumented internal interface in EM/fru-device.  Why are we using it?  There should be EM config that makes a real Inventory interface if we need this.
Ack
